pageContext.claim: “I landed in this airport -- the most incredible thing. We must have spent $3 billion building it. It's one of the reasons I don't want to leave Iraq so fast.”
pageContext.analysis: Al-Asad airbase (which is not an airport) was built in the 1980s with funds from what was then Yugoslavia. It served as a major hub for U.S. Marines during the Iraq War, and was known at the time for having many amenities, which by now have been mostly eliminated. As of 2010, "runways, aircraft shelters and the like account[ed] for about $156 million at the three key air bases of Adder, Al-Asad and Balad," according to Stars and Stripes. The U.S. invested in other ways and continued to invest in the base after 2010, but the available evidence indicates Trump's $3 billion estimate is overblown.
